title: Heki-un-so and Kyoto
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Cities and towns
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Japan - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Japan - Social life and customs
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Rites and ceremonies - Japan
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Gardens, Japanese
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Rites and ceremonies - Japan
description: A visit to the ancient city of Kyoto which is the cradle of ten centureis of history and tradition. Shows the beautiful Heki-un-so gardens, created in the traditional Japanese style, during the four seasons of the year, as well as many examples of ancient and modern Japanese buildings, a tea ceremony and many ceremonies and festivals which are part of the way of life in this ancient capital city of Japan.
